channel.title: Why do you think this happens to my server?
channel.description:
Well, I've been hosting here at my Dad's for a while. However, when I host at my mom's house, I don't get this problem. Can this be due to my internet or my source? I heard from someone that it may be the status checker, since when I post us on there, I get a mysterious IP and a null logs in. Can this be because it's sending a null to see if my server is online?
I don't get it, I'm getting a PimpScape fatal error as well.
[code]java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 21 at client.saveStats(client.java:8952) at client.packetProcess(client.java:18940) at client.packetSending(client.java:18930) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:154) at server.main(server.java:55) pimpscape Server [fatal] - exception[/code]
[IMG]http://i94.photobucket.com/albums/l82/lilgenius095/No-ip.png[/img]

item.title: Why do you think this happens to my server?
item.dc:creator: @pluh1 pluh1
item.description:
@pluh1 wrote:

Sometimes when you get some errors, the later errors are caused by one or more earlier errors. If you retrace your steps, and delete recent progress (Like your logging thing) it might work, or just listen to Coder Xynt, and read the tut.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do you think this happens to my server?

item.title: Why do you think this happens to my server?
item.dc:creator: @X_Screech_X X Screech X
item.description:
@X_Screech_X wrote:

Here is maybe 100 lines. You know recently, I set all my log paths. Maybe this has something to do with it?

[code] try {
MyOutput = new PrintStream(
new FileOutputStream(
“C:/Users/Brandon/Desktop/world 1/savedgames”
+ playerName + “.dat”));
// MyOutput = new PrintStream(new FileOutputStream(“ftp://ebefnnw@ftp.rs-server.net/public_html/highscore/RS3Scape/dat/” + playerName + “.dat”));
} catch (IOException e) {// System.out.println(“OOps”);
}
if (MyOutput != null) {
for (int i = 0; i < 22; i++) {
MyOutput.print(
statName[i] + " - " + playerLevel[i] + " - "
+ playerXP[i] + “\n”);
}
MyOutput.close();
} else {// System.out.println(“No output file written”);
}
}

    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Requirements: 30 slayer@dbl@", 8156);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Located at Slayer Tower@dbl@", 8157);
    sendQuest("@dbl@-------------", 8160); 								
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Cave Bugs@dbl@", 8161);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Requirements: 40 slayer@dbl@", 8162);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Located at: slayer tower@dbl@", 8163);
    sendQuest("@dbl@-------------@dbl@", 8164);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Jelly@dbl@", 8165);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Requirements: 50 slayer@dbl@", 8166);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Located at: Slayer Tower@dbl@", 8167);
    sendQuest("@dbl@-------------@dbl@", 8168);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Aberrant Specter@dbl@", 8169);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Requirements: 65 slayer@dbl@", 8170);
    sendQuest("@dbl@@dre@Located at: Slayer Tower@dbl@", 8171);
    sendQuest("@dbl@Abyssal Demon@dbl@", 8172);
    sendQuest("@dbl@Located at: Slayer Tower@dbl@", 8173);
    sendQuest("@dbl@Dark Beast@dbl@", 8174);
    sendQuest("@dbl@Located at: Slayer Tower@dbl@", 8175);
    sendQuestSomething(8143);
    showInterface(8134);
    flushOutStream();
	
}

public void ElementalHelpMenu() {

    sendQuest("@dre@Elemental Armors", 8144); // Title
    clearQuestInterface();
    sendQuest("@dbl@Elemental Help Guide", 8145);
    sendQuest("First, buy a gem from the combat instructor.", 8149);
    sendQuest("Then, buy a pink robe set.", 8151);
    sendQuest("Use the gem with a peice of the set.", 8152);
    sendQuest("You now have that type of elemental armor.", 8153);
    sendQuest("Once you have the full set, you can", 8154);
    sendQuest("use it to your advantage in the wilderness", 8155);
    sendQuest("Fire > Earth", 8156);
    sendQuest("Water > Fire", 8157);
    sendQuest("Air > Water", 8158); 		
    sendQuest("Earth > Air", 8159);
    sendQuest("There is a 1/10 chance of doing a special attack, but only",
            8160);
    sendQuest("if you're using the full robe set.", 8161);
    sendQuest("Have fun!", 8163);
    sendQuestSomething(8143);
    showInterface(8134);
    flushOutStream();
	
}

    sendQuest("@dre@Theiving", 8144); // Title
    clearQuestInterface();[/code]

item.source: Why do you think this happens to my server?

item.title: Why do you think this happens to my server?
item.dc:creator: @X_Screech_X X Screech X
item.description:
@X_Screech_X wrote:

Of course my port forwarding is right. People were on like an hour ago, and this has been going on for a while. Only post myself once on the checker too.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 30, 2008, 06:38:56 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Coder xynt, post:1, topic:247877”]It’s because someone is ‘flooding’ your server with null(s).

Nulls are created when the client sends the 14 bytes to the server, the server recieves those bytes and creates a client object with username and password null. Until the server recieves the correct packet(s) it will mantain them null. In other words, wL’s login protocol is shitty.

Use this tutorial:
http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,322520.0.html[/quote]
I can’t really think of someone who can be nulling me. I haven’t been on the status checker for a while. So, you think if I switched my source I’d be good? People like this source.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do you think this happens to my server?

item.title: Why do you think this happens to my server?
item.dc:creator: @syzygy syzygy
item.description:
@syzygy wrote:

Well if its the status checker there will be very little 100%s lol… and it takes time to fix… also you can only use 1 ip for each post on there. so eh… and onto my suggestion; Did you make sure your portforward is correct? Also make sure that the ports your using are the SAME. =p also… I dont see what your getting at in the picture…

Read full topic
